intro: Gonolobus dussii, commonly known as the tropical milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, orange to red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Gonolobus dussii is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often used in gardens for its ornamental value.
